title: Ross Kemp can't cope as England beat New Zealand in Rugby World Cup semi-final
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

England made it through to the Rugby World Cup final after beating New Zealand in a tense semi-final.

And no one in the world is happier about the win than Ross Kemp.

Taking to Twitter, the EastEnders actor could barely contain himself as he celebrated with a very, very loud video.

Starting the clip with a bellowing laugh, the 55-year-old screamed: ‘COME ON ENGLAND!

‘Yes, yes, yes! I cannot tell you what that means.

‘It ain’t over yet but we’re pretty close. England OUTSTANDING.’

Ross Kemp celebrates England’s Rugby World Cup win over New Zealand (Picture: Twitter)

We’re pretty sure the team heard him all the way in Japan…

Advertisement

Advertisement

Fans were thrilled to see Ross’ celebrations again, after his now-infamous football World Cup videos went viral last year.

Y’know, before it stopped coming home.

One equally happy follower replied: ‘That’s what we were wIting foooor the Kemp celebration!!!! (sic).’

England beat New Zealand to book a place in the Rugby World Cup final (Picture: Getty)

‘Was waiting for this from the final whistle,’ another commented.

While a follower said: ‘That’s what we are waiting for your celebration!!! What a game!’

And many, many more asked if they could watch next week’s final live with him.

You might want to pack some earplugs if he says yes….

Ross now has to watch all sports solo (Picture: Rex)

Ross opened up about his intense, emotional reactions to sports recently, admitting that he has to watch all the games solo.

During an appearance on Good Morning Britain, the dad-of-four confessed: ‘I have to watch games on my own, I’m never going to play for England but there is a routine there and I’m not breaking it.

‘I generally have to watch it on my own because I’m a danger to myself and others.

‘I am banished to the other end of the house, a hot room.’

We can’t wait to see his victory dance if England win the Rugby World Cup next week…

description: England made it through to the Rugby World Cup final after beating New Zealand in semi-final. And no one is happier than Ross Kemp
